DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study determine safety clinical outcome Absorb BVS daily use patient de novo lesion previously untreated vessel .
DOC.brief_title: To Study Safety Clinical Outcomes Absorb Bioresorbable Vascular Scaffold ( BVS ) System Patients With de Novo Lesions Previously Untreated Vessels
DOC.detailed_description: ABSORB UK registry prospective , single arm , post-market registry design : - Provide ongoing post-market surveillance documentation safety clinical outcome Absorb Everolimus Eluting BVS System daily percutaneous coronary intervention ( PCI ) practice per Instructions Use ( IFU , on-label use ) . - Collect additional information ( e.g . acute success ) evaluate handle implantation Absorb BVS physician wide range commercial use condition follow routine clinical practice .
DOC.criteria: The inclusion criterion must follow recent IFU may include limited following : Patient must least 18 year age time sign Informed Consent Form Patient treat de novo lesion locate previously untreated vessel . Patient must agree undergo require followup visit data collection . The exclusion criterion must follow recent IFU may include limited following : Inability obtain sign informed consent potential patient . Patient belongs vulnerable population ( per investigator 's judgment , also include people direct link ( hierarchical financial benefit ) registry Doctor registry Sponsor ) .
